title: Sony's Xperia XZ Premium 2 could come with a 4K edge-to-edge display
description:
![Sony Xperia XZ
Premium](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Sony could soon take back its position as a serious contender in the
smartphone market, as it’s reportedly scrapping its now-antiquated OmniBalance
design in favour of a more modern bezel-less approach.**

An image surfaced on Reddit on November 29 allegedly highlighting the
specifications of the firm’s successor to its flagship [Xperia XZ
Premium](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/sony-xperia-xz-premium) – and
all signs point towards it featuring a 5.7-inch 4K edge-to-edge display.

That’s a huge step in the right direction, considering Sony is renowned for
pumping out smartphones – even in 2017 – with bezels that are so thick they
could easily be mistaken for two loaves of bread (a bit of an exaggeration, we
know).

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Sony’s OmniBalance design could be usurped

The handset, which could be dubbed the Xperia XZ Premium 2, is said to be
smaller – in height, thickness and width – than the original 5.5-inch Xperia
XZ Premium, and is thought to feature an ultra-tall 18:9 screen.

It’s also expected to come with a [Snapdragon
835](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/snapdragon-835-phones-processor-
specs-speed-benchmark-chipset-cores-2944086) processor, 4GB of RAM, 64GB of
expandable storage and a 3420mAh non-removable battery, and will ship running
[Android 8.0 Oreo](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-8-0-oreo)
skinned with the firm’s Xperia user interface.

There’s no word on when Sony is planning to take the wraps off the Xperia XZ
Premium 2, but it could well be on display at Mobile World Congress 2018 in
February, as its predecessor was unveiled at the same event this year.
